variables.name: Simulation time
variables.description: This is the total hydrodynamic simulation time of a model run.

variables.name: Output interval
variables.description: This is the output interval used for the map output (2D and 3D), observation point output and the profile output.

variables.name: Basin slope
variables.description: This is the bed level slope between the coastline and the offshore model boundary.

variables.name: Channel width
variables.description: This is the width of the river channel excluding the floodplains (not availalbe for the Roda and Sobrarbe templates).

variables.name: River length
variables.description: This is the number of cells between the landward model boundary and the coastline. This parameter is only for the use of the preprocessing scripts but is not editable.

variables.name: Initial river discharge per channel
variables.description: This is the initial river discharge per channel (one channel in the case of River dominated delta, Gule Horn/Neslen and Roda; four channels in the case of Sobrarbe). If this value coincides with the value chosen for the final river discharge, a constant discharge is applied during the entire simulation. If the values differ, a time varying river discharge is applied based on a linear interpolation between the values for the initial and the final river discharges.

variables.name: Final river discharge per channel
variables.description: This is the final river discharge per channel (one channel in the case of River dominated delta, Gule Horn/Neslen and Roda; four channels in the case of Sobrarbe). If this value coincides with the value chosen for the initial river discharge, a constant discharge is applied during the entire simulation. If the values differ, a time varying river discharge is applied based on a linear interpolation between the values for the initial and the final river discharges.

variables.name: Tidal amplitude
variables.description: This is the tidal amplitude at the offshore model boundary.

variables.name: Initial significant wave height
variables.description: This is the initial significant wave height applied to the model. If this value coincides with the value chosen for the final significant wave height, a constant wave height is applied during the entire simulation. If the values differ, a time varying wave height is applied based on a linear interpolation between the values for the initial and the final wave heights.

variables.name: Final significant wave height
variables.description: This is the final significant wave height applied to the model. If this value coincides with the value chosen for the initial significant wave height, a constant wave height is applied during the entire simulation. If the values differ, a time varying wave height is applied based on a linear interpolation between the values for the initial and the final wave heights.

variables.name: Mean wave direction relative to North
variables.description: This is the mean wave direction according to the nautical convention (0 degrees = waves from the North/orthogonal to the coast).

variables.name: Subsidence between landward model boundary and coastline
variables.description: This is the amount by which the bed level between the landward model boundary and the coastline will be subsided by the end of the simulation (constant subsidence rate between 0 m and the chosen value). If this value coincides with the value chosen for the seaward model boundary, a uniform subsidence for the whole model domain is applied. If the values differ, a spatially varying subsidence is applied based on a linear interpolation between both values.

variables.name: Subsidence at seaward model boundary
variables.description: This is the amount by which the bed level at the seaward model boundary will be subsided by the end of the simulation (constant subsidence rate between 0 m and the chosen value). If this value coincides with the value chosen for the area between the landward model boundary and the coastline, a uniform subsidence for the whole model domain is applied. If the values differ, a spatially varying subsidence is applied based on a linear interpolation between both values.

sections.name: Sediment composition

variables.name: Sediment classes
variables.description: This is the grain size distribution (vol-%) of the fluvial sediment input and the initial bed composition. Coarse sand: 10% vc, 10% c, 15% m, 35% f, 20% vf, 10% mud; Medium sand: 5% vc, 5% c, 10% m, 35% f, 35% vf, 10% mud; Fine sand: 2% vc, 3% c, 5% m, 30% f, 45% vf, 15% mud; Very fine sand: 2% vc, 3% c, 5% m, 25% f, 35% vf, 30% mud; Coarse silt: 5% c, 5% m, 25% f, 35% vf, 15% mud A, 15% mud B.

sections.description: Sediment can consist of a mixture of different classes. Read more about the sediment composition clasess.
